articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website
articles.contents:
Greetings
My name is Alex Kuai, and I am a freshman to be at Newton North High
School. After exhausting many different project ideas found on the
internet, I finally landed on one that I think would be suitable for me.
Semiconductors.
About the Project
This project is about microchips and it’s effect on a country’s
population..
“This is Data Science”

Preceptor

Kane’s Free High School
Data Science Bootcamp

articles.title: Semiconductor Demand
articles.description: Semiconductor demand in the past 35 years.
articles.contents:
Raw Data
This is the raw data from the original xls file downloaded from the
website.




Looking at this, it isn’t pretty. The years are in the same column as
the countries, column names are all messed up do to how this was
formatted; so then it was time to wrangle it into place.
Wrangling
Scanning through the data, it was clear that we needed to first
change the names of these columns, because they were all messed up.
Furthermore, the countries column has the years in it. That isn’t
right. So we need a new column to hold the years, then delete all of the
ones from where they aren’t supposed to be.
After polishing this dataset into something usable, here it is!

# A tibble: 144 × 19
   Regions      January February March  April May   June  July  August
   <chr>        <chr>   <chr>    <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> 
 1 Americas     555850  633465   756220 6894… 7183… 7970… 7077… 697506
 2 Europe       346467  401765   461912 4367… 4461… 4725… 4394… 426172
 3 Japan        638547  750366   840215 8380… 8705… 9224… 9968… 914476
 4 Asia Pacific 105050  115746   147968 1564… 1675… 1850… 1860… 187628
 5 Americas     662316  695384   879953 7830… 8190… 9340… 8517… 875491
 6 Europe       446216  460982   551635 4831… 5226… 5422… 4593… 456098
 7 Japan        839651  885850   947246 9373… 9803… 1064… 1093… 10000…
 8 Asia Pacific 189473  218174   258402 2703… 2859… 3077… 2997… 290902
 9 Americas     905615  960564   11289… 1016… 1081… 1248… 1119… 11622…
10 Europe       549355  619132   755057 6468… 6666… 7669… 5864… 608248
# … with 134 more rows, and 10 more variables: September <chr>,
#   October <chr>, November <chr>, December <chr>, Total_Year <dbl>,
#   Q1 <chr>, Q2 <chr>, Q3 <chr>, Q4 <chr>, year <int>

Semiconductor Demand
From Four Regions
Historical billings of semiconductor demand from the Americas, the
Asia Pacific, Europe, and Japan are shown here.



(WSTS
2022)
There is massive growth in semiconductor demand in the Asia Pacific
Region, peaking at almost 343 million semiconductor units reported to be
purchased.
The semiconductor demand in the Americas have steadily increased, but
nowhere near the growth of the Asia Pacific region.
Demand for semiconductors in Europe and Japan have been relatively
low, and there haven’t been any particularly high amounts of growth
demand for them either.



WSTS. 2022. World Semiconductor Trade Statistics Historical Billigns
Report. WSTS. https://www.wsts.org/67/Historical-Billings-Report.

articles.title: Country growth
articles.description: This section is focusing on a country's technological growth.
articles.contents:
Raw Data
The raw data for this graph is here.




Here is the polished version and the end product it created.





(Bank
2022)
Conclusion
We can see that in this graph, just like the semiconductor demand
graph, had the Asia Pacific Region leading in population growth, and the
other countries trailing behind, and perhaps this is because of improved
living conditions due to an influx of microchips.



Bank, World. 2022. Population, Total. World Bank. https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SP.POP.TOTL.

articles.title: Microchip Market
articles.description: Welcome to the website. I hope you enjoy it!
articles.contents:
Introduction
How many of you have wondered what exactly is in your computer? Based
on this article’s title, you’ve probably guessed already.
Semiconductors. These little chips in your phones and computers are the
center for their core operations as well as advanced capabilities. Lets
see the difference in population between countries to compare what
effect microchips may have on it.
Tabs in the top right

articles.title: Summary
articles.description: This is a summary of the findings in this project.
articles.contents:
Description
I compared four regions’ microchip demand and their respective
populations. The Asia Pacific’s semiconductor demand and initial
population growth was unmatched by any of the other four regions that I
focused on; however as we approach modern day, the Asia Pacific’s
population line begins to flatten out. This is not unwarranted; it can
be represented by a phenomena that describes how birth rates per year in
more developed countries are lower than in developing ones. One part of
the reason that the Asia Pacific region appears to be nearing the end of
this phenomena could be due to it’s dramatic growth in semiconductor
demand relative to the other regions, catapulting it’s economic and
technological status.
